name: iStartsWith

args.name: prefix
args.description: Substring to be found at the start of param1 ignoring case sensitivity.

description:
Binary function that tests if this string starts with the specified prefix while ignoring case.
For example, the prefix "cyo" on the string "Cyoda is cool" will return true. If either of the inputs is null, then false is returned

name: EncLength
description: Unary function return the length of an input string as long

name: endsWith

args.name: suffix
args.description: Substring to be found at the end of param1

description: Binary function that returns TRUE the given string in param1 ends with the given suffix.

name: and
description: Multivariate function that checks if any of the input parameter values are FALSE. Returns TRUE if and only if all boolean paramters have value TRUE. The mininum number of args is 2, the Max args count is unbounded

name: DateToString
description:
Converts LocalDate to string using provided format                    "yyyy-MM-dd", // default
                    "yyyy.MM.dd",
                    "yyyy.MMM.dd",
                    "yyyy-MMM-dd",
                    "MM/dd/yyyy",
For for more information about LocalDate and other formats please check the following doc page: 
https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/time/format/DateTimeFormatter.html

name: sortComparableElements
description: Sorts comparable elements

name: cast

args.name: class-name
args.description: The name that the value needs to be converted to. These may be: List, Set, Map, Comparable, String, Integer or the fully qualified Java class name, for example java.lang.Double

description: Unary function that converts the input from one type of value to another. For example, use this to convert a string representation of a number to a Double

name: LessThanEquals

args.name: param1
args.description: if param1 is less than param 2 true is returned

args.name: param2
args.description: if param2 is bigger than param1 false is returned

description: Binary function that compares two comparable values. Comparables are typically numbers and dates (i.e. you can't compare a String with a Double). In general, there is no guarantee that comparing two different Comparables will work (like comparing a date to a number) The function will return true if param1 is LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO param2 otherwise it will return false.

name: startsWith

args.name: prefix
args.description: Substring to be found at the start of param1

description: Tests if this string starts with the specified prefix.

name: enlargeFromList
description: Enlarges from list. For more background on when and how to use this function, please refer to the COBI documentation or ask for support. We are working hard on improving the docs to make it more clear.

name: DateToString
description:
Converts date to string using provided format and timezone
yyyy.MM.dd
yyyy.MMM.dd
yyyy-MM-dd
yyyy-MMM-dd
MM/dd/yyyy
yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ
yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX
for more information about other formats please checkout the following doc page: 
https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html

name: minComparableElement
description: Unary function that returns the element in the list that has the minimum value. The elements must be Comparable to each other. Comparables are typically numbers and dates.

name: toGroupByMap

args.name: keys
args.description: list of keys, parameter of type List

args.name: values
args.description: list of values, parameter of type List

description: bla bla bla

name: greaterThanEquals
description: Binary function that compares two comparable values. Comparables are typically numbers and dates (i.e. you can't compare a String with a Double). In general, there is no guarantee that comparing two different Comparables will work (like comparing a date to a number) The function will return true if param1 is GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO param2, otherwise it will return false. This a "null-friendly" comparator that considers null to be less than a non-null value

name: avgElement
description: Reduce function. Gets average element from list of comparable elements

name: AddToList
description: Simple function takes two arguments, an elemenet and a list ,returns a list with the added element

name: concatElements

args.name: delimiter
args.description: delimiter used between elements can be any string

description:
Reduce function. Converts list of values to single value by joining them with delimiter
Example:
list :a b c d 
delimeter: , 
output: a,b,c,d
If escape-delimiter is true, then delimiters are escaped
suppose an element was: "a,b" then it is converted to "a\,b" before concatenation

name: to-singleton-list

args.name: value
args.description: the actual value to be transformed

description: converts signle element to a list

name: isNull
description: Unary function that returns TRUE if the parameter is NULL

name: asMap
description:
Multivariate function that takes the given even number of input parameters and associates these to a map. The key is every second parameter, starting with the first, and the value is the also every second parameter starting with the second. For example, given four input parameters: param1=key1, param2=value1, param3=key2, param4=value2, results in a map with two elements: key1->value1, key2->value2.
Null keys are silently ignored, i.e. if the corresponding parameter for a key is null, it will not be set and there will be no warning.

name: toFilteredList
description:
Binary function that removes from a given list the elements at the positions defined in the parameter filterResult. The filterResult must be a list of the same size as the input list, containing boolean elements. At each position in the filterResult list where the element is FALSE, the corresponding element is removed.
For example: 
list: Cat, Dog, Horse, Hamster 
filterResuts: TRUE, FALSE, FALSE , TRUE 
output: Cat, Hamster

name: toSet

args.name: list
args.description: list of values to be converted to a set

description: Unary function to convert a list to a set. A list may contain duplicates (in the sense of two elements being equal to each other), a set has duplicates removed.

name: ifElse

args.name: exprTrue
args.description: Expression value returned if conditionalExpression is TRUE

args.name: exprFalse
args.description: Expression value returned if conditionalExpression is FALSE

description: If/Else function. Takes 3 args. First arg is condition. Returns second arg if condition is TRUE, else returns third arg

name: not
description: Unary function to return the negative a boolean input parameter. So TRUE will become FALSE and vice versa.

name: getElementByIndex

args.name: index
args.description: index of element to get, parameter of type number.

description: Binary function that returns the element of list given by the index. The first element in the list has index 0 (zero), so for a list of N elements, valid choices for the index is 0..N-1

name: matchesRegex
description: Binary function that tests if a string matches a specified regular expression. The expression follows the specifications of  Java Regular Expressions for which there is ample documentation and tutorials in the internet.

name: toUniqueList
description: Converts list of values to List of unique values

name: DocumentConverter

args.name: param
args.description: String representation of document in byte array

description: Function stores document and retrieves url

name: toList
description: Converts 0 or many values to a List. For more background on when and how to use this function, please refer to the COBI documentation or ask for support. We are working hard on improving the docs to make it more clear.

name: endsWith

args.name: suffix
args.description: Substring to be found at the end of param1 ignoring case

description: Binary function that returns TRUE the given string in param1 ends with the given suffix, ignoring case, i.e. the check is case-insensitve.

name: AppendToList

args.name: Element
args.description: Element to be added to list

description:
Multivariate function that allows user to add one or more element to a list of values, returns the updated list.
note that the type of added elements must be the same as the type of the elements inside the list

name: AppendToMap
description:
Multivariate function that allows user to add one or more key/value pairs to a Map of values, returns the updated map.
note that the type of added elements must be the same as the type of the elements inside the map

name: contains

args.name: substring
args.description: Substring to be found in param1 ignoring cases

description: Binary function to tests if a given string contains the specified substring, ignoring case. If the substring is contained irregardless of the case, the function returns TRUE, else FALSE. If either of the parametes is null, FALSE is returned. Example: "The cat in the hat" contains the substring "CAT in", ignoring case

name: equals
description: Binary function that checks that two arguments equal each other. It can be used to compare equality for any type of objects. If both arguments are null, true is returned and if exactly one argument is null, false is returned

name: ifElseNull

args.name: exprTrue
args.description: Expression value returned if conditionalExpression is TRUE

description: Binary function that returns the second parameter if the first parameter is TRUE, else it returns NULL.

name: isBlank
description:
Checks if a String is whitespace, empty ("") or null.
       StringUtils.isBlank(null)      = true
       StringUtils.isBlank("")        = true
       StringUtils.isBlank(" ")       = true
       StringUtils.isBlank("bob")     = false
       StringUtils.isBlank("  bob  ") = false

name: getElementByKey
description: Gets element from map by key

name: maxComparableElement
description: Unary function that returns the element in the list that has the maximum value. The elements must be Comparable to each other. Comparables are typically numbers and dates.

name: IEquals
description: Binary function that checks that two string arguments equal each other, ignoring case, returning TRUE if they are case-insensitively equal, else it returns FALSE. Both arguments must not be NULL. Note the difference between "Equals" and "IEquals", the first can be used to compare any type of objects, however the latter can only be used to compare strings.

name: concat
description: Concatenate all args. Min args count - 2, Max args count - unbounded

name: EncJoinLists
description: Multivariate function takes two lists as minimum arguments, appends elements and return new list the contain the total elements  Multiple lists can be provided as input

name: to-singleton-list

args.name: value
args.description: the actual value to be transformed

description: converts signle element to a list

name: isNotNull
description: Function checks argument is NOT NULL

name: joinLists
description: Multivariate function takes two lists as minimum arguments, appends elements and return new list the contain the total elements  Multiple lists can be provided as input

name: toMap

args.name: keys
args.description: list of keys, parameter of type List

args.name: values
args.description: list of values, parameter of type List

description:
Binary function that converts list of keys and list of values to Map<String, Object>
Keys can be considered as indices and values are the content those indicies refer to.
Map keys must be unqiue whereas Map values can contain duplicates.
Both lists must be of equal size and the list of keys should not contain duplicates.
If the keys do contain duplicates, the last one transferred wins and the size of the map will be correspondingly smaller.

name: greaterThan
description: Binary function that compares two comparable values. Comparables are typically numbers and dates (i.e. you can't compare a String with a Double). In general, there is no guarantee that comparing two different Comparables will work (like comparing a date to a number) The function will return true if param1 is GREATER THAN param2, otherwise it will return false. This a "null-friendly" comparator that considers null to be less than a non-null value

name: enlargeFromCollection
description: Enlarges from collection. For more background on when and how to use this function, please refer to the COBI documentation or ask for support. We are working hard on improving the docs to make it more clear.

name: InstanceOf

args.name: class
args.description: Class type to check object type against

description: Returns TRUE if an Object is an instance of a given Java Class. This allows the function to know the type of a value, for example java.lang.String, java.lang.Number. You can use the StringValueTransformer "toClass" to convert a fully qualified Java class name to its class. For the moment, you need to know what these are. Sorry about that.

name: switch
description: return value for the first successful assertion. Null if every one fails.

name: or
description: Multivariate function that checks if any of the input parameter values are TRUE. Returns TRUE as soon as any one of the input parameters is TRUE. The mininum number of args is 2, the Max args count is unbounded

name: Compare
description: Binary function to compare two objects. Returns a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer if the first argument is less than, equal to, or greater than the second, respectively. Comparables are typically numbers and dates (i.e. you can't compare a String with a Double). In general, there is no guarantee that comparing two different Comparables will work (like comparing a date to a number). The actual precise logic is coded in the class of the first parameter, as per the contract in the Java "Comparable" interface, in particular the compareTo() method. The interested ready may check that up in readily available Java documentation for Comparable.

name: Length
description: Unary function return the length of an input string as long

name: contains

args.name: substring
args.description: Substring to be found in param1

description: Binary function to tests if a given string contains the specified substring. If the substring is contained, the function returns TRUE, else FALSE. If either of the parametes is null, FALSE is returned. Example: "The cat in the hat" contains the substring "cat in"

name: transform

args.name: transformerKey
args.description: Identifier for the transformer(unique for each one)

args.name: value
args.description: the actual value to be transformed

description: Binary function to transform a value using a given transformer. Purpose of this method is to be to use Transformers in functional mappings, which can be handy in converting between multiple types. Check the help or docs on Transformers to learn more about them.

name: lessThan

args.name: param1
args.description: The first value in the comparison

args.name: param2
args.description: The second value in the comparison

description: Binary function that compares two comparable values. Comparables are typically numbers and dates (i.e. you can't compare a String with a Double). In general, there is no guarantee that comparing two different Comparables will work (like comparing a date to a number) The function will return true if param1 is LESS THAN param2, otherwise it will return false. This a "null-friendly" comparator that considers null to be less than a non-null value
